titlestmt.titleproper: Finding aid for the Abner Pratt papers

profiledesc.creation: Encoded finding aid created from MARC record by Dallas Pillen
profiledesc.langusage: The finding aid is written in English

physdesc.extent: .2 linear ft. (1 item and 6 microfilm reels

descgrp.originalsloc: Department of State records: Originals held by National Archives and Records Administration, Washington, D.C.

archdesc.bioghist: Michigan Democratic politician and U.S. Consul to Honolulu, Hawaii, 1857-1861.
archdesc.scopecontent: Records of the Department of State relating to Pratt's service in Honolulu, including dispatches from U.S. Consuls in Honolulu (1855-1861), dispatches from U.S. Ministers to Hawaii (1856-1860), letters of consular instruction for Hawaii (1855-1860), and diplomatic instructions of the Department of State for Hawaii (1848-1885); also a letter to his family describing his voyage to Hawaii and his immediate impressions of Honolulu.
